description.content: A simple Postman Collection for integrating with the ONLYOFFICE DocSpace API

request.description: Adds a new group with the group manager, name, and members specified in the request.

The number of records to retrieve.
The starting index for paginated results.

request.description: Returns the general information about all the groups, such as group ID and group manager.   **Note**: This method returns partial group information.

Replaces the group members with those specified in the request.
Returns a list of groups for the user with the ID specified in the request.

item.name: Client Management
item.description: APIs for managing OAuth2 clients, including creation, updates, deletion, and activation.

request.description: Creates a new OAuth2 client with the specified configuration. The client will be created with the provided scopes, redirect URIs, and other settings. Returns the created client details including the generated client ID.
Permanently deletes an OAuth2 client and all associated data. All access and refresh tokens issued to this client will be invalidated. This operation cannot be undone.
Updates the configuration of an existing OAuth2 client, allowing modifications to the client name, description, redirect URIs, and other settings. The client ID cannot be modified.
Activates or deactivates an OAuth2 client. When deactivated, the client cannot request new access tokens, but existing tokens will remain valid until they expire.

Generates a new client secret for the specified OAuth2 client. The old secret will be immediately invalidated. This operation should be used with caution as it requires updating the secret in all client applications.

Revokes all user consents for the specified OAuth2 client. This will invalidate all access tokens and refresh tokens issued to this client for the current user. The user will need to re-authorize the client to access their resources.

item.name: Operations
item.description: Operations for performing actions on files and folders.

request.description:
Creates the session to upload large files in multiple chunks to the folder with the ID specified in the request. **Note**: Each chunk can have different length but the length should be multiple of 512 and greater or equal to 10 mb. Last chunk can have any size. After the initial response to the request with the 200 OK status, you must get the location field value from the response. Send all your chunks to this location. Each chunk must be sent in the exact order the chunks appear in the file. After receiving each chunk, the server will respond with the current information about the upload session if no errors occurred. When the number of bytes uploaded is equal to the number of bytes you sent in the initial request, the server responds with the 201 Created status and sends you information about the uploaded file. Information about created session which includes:
  • id: unique ID of this upload session,
  • created: UTC time when the session was created,
  • expired: UTC time when the session will expire if no chunks are sent before that time,
  • location: URL where you should send your next chunk,
  • bytes_uploaded: number of bytes uploaded for the specific upload ID,
  • bytes_total: total number of bytes which will be uploaded.
Adds files and folders with the IDs specified in the request to the favorite list.

request.description: Returns a list of all the portal storages.
Resets the storage settings to the default parameters.
Updates a storage with the parameters specified in the request.
Returns a list of all the backup storages.
Returns a list of all the CDN storages.
Resets the CDN storage settings to the default parameters.
Updates the CDN storage with the parameters specified in the request.
Returns the storage progress.
Returns a list of all Amazon regions.

item.name: Quota
item.description: Operations for working with quota settings.

item.name: Save the AI Agent quota settings

request.description: Saves the AI Agent quota settings specified in the request to the current portal.
Saves the room quota settings specified in the request to the current portal.
Saves the tenant quota settings specified in the request to the current portal.
Returns the user quota settings.

item.name: Common settings
item.description: Operations for working with common settings.

query.description: Specifies whether to include the password hashing configuration in the response.

request.description: Returns a list of all the available portal settings with the current values for each parameter.
Closes the administrator helper notification.

query.description: The ID of the portal theme to delete.

request.description: Deletes the portal color theme with the ID specified in the request.
Returns the portal color theme.
Saves the portal color theme specified in the request.
Returns a list of all the available portal languages in the format of a two-letter or four-letter language code (e.g. "de", "en-US", etc.).
Saves the deep link configuration settings for the portal.
Returns the deep link settings.
Saves the DNS settings specified in the request to the current portal.
Updates the email activation settings.
Returns the portal user invitation settings.
Updates the portal user invitation settings.
Returns the portal logo image URL.
Returns the portal hostname.
Saves the mail domain settings specified in the request to the portal.
Returns the portal payment settings.
Returns the socket settings.
Returns a list of all the available portal time zones.
Completes the Wizard settings.

item.name: Cookies
item.description: Operations for working with cookies settings.

request.description: Returns the cookies lifetime value in minutes.
Updates the cookies lifetime value in minutes.

item.name: Login settings
item.description: Operations for working with login settings.

request.description: Returns the portal login settings.
Resets the portal login settings to default.
Updates the login settings with the parameters specified in the request.

item.name: Webhooks
item.description: Operations for working with webhook settings.

request.description: Creates a new tenant webhook with the parameters specified in the request.
Returns a list of the tenant webhooks.
Updates a tenant webhook with the parameters specified in the request.

variable.description: The ID extracted from the route parameters.

request.description: Removes a tenant webhook with the ID specified in the request.

variable.description: The ID extracted from the route parameters.

request.description: Retries a webhook with the ID specified in the request.
Enables or disables a tenant webhook with the parameters specified in the request.
Retries all the webhooks with the IDs specified in the request.
Returns a list of triggers for a webhook.

query.description: The delivery start time for filtering webhook logs.
The delivery end time for filtering webhook logs.
The destination URL where webhooks are delivered.
The webhook configuration identifier.
The unique identifier of the event that triggered the webhook.
The status of the webhook delivery group.
The identifier of the user associated with the webhook event.
The type of event that triggered the webhook.
The maximum number of webhook log records to return in the query response.
Specifies the starting index for retrieving webhook logs.  Used for pagination in the webhook delivery log queries.

request.description: Returns the logs of the webhook activities.

item.name: TFA settings
item.description: Operations for working with TFA settings.

request.description: Returns the current two-factor authentication settings.
Updates the two-factor authentication settings with the parameters specified in the request.
Returns the confirmation email URL for authorization via SMS or TFA application.
Generates the setup TFA code for the current user.
Validates the two-factor authentication code specified in the request.
Returns the two-factor authentication application codes.
Unlinks the current two-factor authentication application from the user account specified in the request.
Requests the new backup codes for the two-factor authentication application.

item.name: Get a confirmation email for updating TFA settings

request.description: Returns the confirmation email URL for updating TFA settings.

item.name: Notifications
item.description: Operations for working with notification settings.

request.description: Enables the notification type specified in the request.

variable.description: The type of notification to query, specified in the route.

request.description: Checks if the notification type specified in the request is enabled or not.
Returns a list of notification channels.
Returns a list of rooms with the disabled notifications.
Sets a notification status for a room with the ID specified in the request.
